abstract: Government authorities plan to arrest two former employees suspected of masking the size of a multibillion-dollar trading loss.
snippet: Government authorities plan to arrest two former employees suspected of masking the size of a multibillion-dollar trading loss.
lead_paragraph: Updated, 9:30 p.m. | Government authorities are planning to arrest two former JPMorgan Chase employees suspected of masking the size of a multibillion-dollar trading loss, a dramatic turn in a case that tarnished the reputation of the nation’s biggest bank and spotlighted the perils of Wall Street risk-taking.

headline.main: U.S. Said to Plan to Arrest Pair in Big Bank Loss
headline.print_headline: U.S. Said to Plan To Arrest Pair In Big Bank Loss

byline.original: By Ben Protess and Jessica Silver-Greenberg
